instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: original board had no lcd enable, replaced with new board, and it wont boot to the os. it shows the folder icon, 'so the lcd was good like i originally thought" the problem is even with a working os it wont boot to it, it will boot to a usb os, but takes 10-15 min to get in, even to boot to the os install media takes 5-10 min. ran apple diag and it passed on extended. i have no idea what could cause this kind of issue, ssd does get read in the disk management, and i formatted it and reinstalled. but no change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
These boards are known for <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> issue, but seems that is not your case.
Looks more like ME issue; reflash BIOS with clean ME.

BTW, reflow/resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: i have never flashed a bios, how would i go about doing that? is there a video or a site for me to learn?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
Oops, I supposed you don't have programmer.
If you plan to stay in business with Apple stuff, get Medusa 2.
Google can bring you a lot of info about BIOS programming...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: ok i see how that tool works, but at the moment i wont be able to get that tool, do you know if anyone does it for a fee and if so how much?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
You must find someone in your area.
Ask in few service places and choose the best option...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: there is no one nearby  im from kansas

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
You can buy a cheap BIOS programmer, if you do not repair laptops diary.
Even CH341 should do the job...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
Honnestly as 2Informaticos said higher in the Post : buy a Medusa 2 box from Harald ([url]http://www.cmizapper.com/products/medusa-2.html[/url]).
you'll see it worth it:
it will save you a lot of time and do many tasks easily

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: buy a TL866 Mini Pro programmer. they are inexpensive and very easy to use. works on all kind of laptop's bios chip. Louis Rossmann has a guide on this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message: Very good suggestion Alan, this is exactly what I've got: both TL866 + Medusa 2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a wont boot to os
threads.message:
Good choice.
Because I forgot to mention, Medusa 2 requires a normal programmer to interface it with your service pc...
